name: American Near East Refugee Aid (Anera)
mission: Since 1968, Anera has helped refugees and others hurt by conflicts in the Middle East live with dignity and purpose. Anera, which has no political or re...
theoryOfChange: Anera states its programs grow from grassroots solutions and deliver lasting change; Women Can emphasizes sustainability by building skills and supporting enterprise creation/expansion ("teach them how to fish").

judge_issues.message: Jargon detected in baseline narrative: 'asnaf categories'

score_details.score_summary: American Near East Refugee Aid (Anera) earns 78/100 due to exceptional alignment and strong impact, with zakat compliance.

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.anera.org/zakat (Source: https://www.anera.org/zakat)

all_citations.claim: Anera holds a 100.0/100 rating and maintains a 96.3% program expense ratio.
Anera is zakat-eligible and follows specific policies for asnaf categories.
The organization reported total revenue of $173,279,297 and focuses on health and education programs.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Anera earns a strong overall score due to its perfect financial health rating and high alignment with humanitarian needs, though its impact score reflects the high costs associated with direct aid provision.
areas_for_improvement: Relatively lean working capital of 1.2 months
High cost per beneficiary for certain direct provision programs

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization shows high alignment for donors seeking to address urgent humanitarian crises in the Middle East [1]. Its long track record since 1968 and its formal zakat-eligibility policy make it a high-fit option for Muslim donors looking to fulfill religious obligations through established NGOs [2][3].
dimension_explanations.impact: Anera demonstrates high effectiveness through direct provision of aid, managing a total revenue of $173,279,297 with a 96.3% program expense ratio [1][3]. While the cost per beneficiary is calculated at 17588.2619, the organization maintains a perfect 100.0/100 rating from Charity Navigator, reflecting robust financial health and accountability [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: American Near East Refugee Aid (Anera) provides critical humanitarian relief and sustainable development to refugees in the Middle East with exceptional financial efficiency.
strengths: Highly efficient fundraising cost of only $0.01 per $1 raised
Verified zakat-eligible status with clear distribution policies
baseline_narrative.summary: founded in 1968, Anera delivers large-scale health, education, and economic development programs to refugees and vulnerable communities in the Middle East [1][3]. The organization is recognized as zakat-eligible, maintaining a dedicated policy to ensure donations reach those in need according to asnaf categories [2].

all_citations.quote: Areas Served: Jordan, Lebanon, Palestinian Territory

all_citations.claim: perfect 100/100 overall score from Charity Navigator
Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Anera earns a strong overall score due to its perfect financial health rating and high alignment with humanitarian needs, though its impact score reflects the high costs associated with direct aid provision.

areas_for_improvement.detail: The organization currently maintains <cite id="14">1.2 months of working capital</cite> in reserve, which is healthy but could be strengthened to ensure long-term stability during volatile periods.

Due to the high-intensity nature of direct medical and infrastructure provision, the <cite id="15">average cost per beneficiary is $17,588.26</cite>, which is higher than some peer humanitarian models.

bbb_assessment.summary: Maintains high standards of governance and financial accountability.

case_against.mitigation_notes: Anera mitigates these risks through a <cite id="10">58-year track record</cite> and a large, diversified revenue base.
risk_factors: <cite id="14">Leaner working capital</cite> compared to some institutional peers
Operational dependency on <cite id="11">foreign implementing partners</cite> in volatile areas
case_against.summary: The primary limitation is the <cite id="15">high cost per beneficiary</cite> associated with its direct provision model and the inherent risks of operating in high-conflict zones.

confidence.notes: Extremely high data availability and perfect ratings from third parties.

known_gaps: Detailed staff count not in provided summary

alignment.explanation: Anera is a strong fit for Muslim donors due to its <cite id="7">explicit zakat program</cite> and focus on <cite id="8">underserved populations in Muslim-majority regions</cite>.
alignment.improvement: Expand services to <cite id="1">additional underserved regions</cite> with limited nonprofit coverage to maximize the 'Underserved Space' score.

credibility.explanation: Anera is highly credible, holding a <cite id="6">100.0/100 from Charity Navigator score</cite> and a <cite id="9">Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite>. Its <cite id="12">96.3% independent board</cite> provides robust oversight.
credibility.improvement: To further enhance credibility, Anera could publish more frequent third-party impact evaluations to complement its <cite id="16">tracked outcome metrics</cite>.

impact.explanation: Impact is driven by a <cite id="3">100.0% program ratio</cite> and direct provision of aid. The organization <cite id="16">tracks three key outcome metrics</cite> via Candid.
impact.improvement: Build working capital reserves to <cite id="14">1-1.2 months of working capital</cite> to ensure sustained delivery during funding fluctuations.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Tracked outcomes with clear theory of change

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Distributes in-kind medical supplies and cash grants to local partners

rich_narrative.headline: American Near East Refugee Aid (Anera) provides critical humanitarian relief and sustainable development to refugees in the Middle East with exceptional financial efficiency.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to fulfill zakat obligations through a highly efficient, established institution with a perfect transparency record in the Middle East.
donor_motivations: Prioritize maximum financial efficiency (96.3% program ratio)
Want to support Palestinian and Lebanese refugees
Value long-term institutional stability and regional expertise
giving_considerations: Donations support large-scale infrastructure and medical logistics
Operates in high-risk conflict zones requiring complex navigation
High cost per beneficiary due to the nature of direct aid
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking low-cost, high-volume interventions (like deworming) or those focused on domestic US poverty.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects that while Anera <cite id="16">tracks outcome metrics</cite> and has a clear theory of change, it lacks publicly available RCT-level evidence.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Anera utilizes a direct provision model to improve health, education, and economic dignity for refugees, transitioning from emergency relief to sustainable development.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that large-scale medical and agricultural interventions actually improve long-term refugee self-sufficiency.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: Given the ongoing crises in Gaza and Lebanon, Anera has significant capacity to absorb and deploy additional humanitarian funding.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Anera's <cite id="3">100.0% program ratio</cite> significantly exceeds the <cite id="17">peer median of 89.7%</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Broader global reach beyond the Middle East
similar_organizations.name: International Rescue Committee

similar_organizations.differentiator: Intergovernmental agency vs Anera's NGO status
similar_organizations.name: UNRWA

strengths.detail: Anera maintains a <cite id="3">96.3% program expense ratio</cite> and spends only <cite id="4">$0.01 to raise every dollar</cite>.
The organization holds a <cite id="6">perfect 100.0/100 from Charity Navigator</cite> and a <cite id="9">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>.
With a history <cite id="10">dating back to 1968</cite>, Anera has decades of experience navigating complex humanitarian landscapes in the Middle East.

strengths_deep_dive: Anera's operational model is built on high-volume direct provision and strategic partnerships. In 2023, the organization managed <cite id="11">$38,290,573 in foreign grants</cite> across 171 recipients, demonstrating its capacity as a major regional grantmaker. Its governance is supported by a <cite id="12">large board of 71 members</cite>, ensuring diverse oversight and 96.3% independent board membership. Furthermore, the organization has shown robust growth with a <cite id="13">3-year revenue CAGR of 24.1%</cite>, indicating strong donor trust and expanding capacity to meet rising humanitarian needs in Gaza and the West Bank.
rich_narrative.summary: founded in 1968, American Near East Refugee Aid (Anera) is a leading humanitarian organization dedicated to serving refugees and vulnerable communities in <cite id="1">Palestine, Lebanon, and Jordan</cite>. The organization operates at a significant scale, reporting <cite id="2">$173,279,297 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 fiscal year. Anera is distinguished by its <cite id="3">exceptional program expense ratio of 96.3%</cite>, ensuring that every dollar of public contribution is directed toward its core missions of health, education, and economic development. This financial efficiency is further evidenced by a <cite id="4">fundraising efficiency of $0.01 per $1 raised</cite>, a metric that places it at the top tier of international NGOs. Beyond emergency relief, Anera implements long-term sustainable development projects, including <cite id="5">in-kind medical supply delivery</cite> and agricultural support. The organization maintains a <cite id="6">perfect 100/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting its commitment to transparency and accountability. For Muslim donors, Anera offers a <cite id="7">verified zakat-eligible program</cite> that adheres to traditional asnaf categories, specifically serving the <cite id="8">poor (fuqara), needy (masakin), and wayfarers (ibn sabil)</cite>.
